meanings.sent1: The little brother would importuner his sister for candy every day after school.
meanings.sent2: She would importuner her parents to take her to the park on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel would importuner the cat by stealing its food and running away.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet importunered her with its constant rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent5: The persistent rain importunered the farmers, delaying their harvest.

meanings.definition: A person who persistently annoys or pesters others
meanings.sent1: The importuner at school would always ask for extra pencils from classmates.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the class importuner because she never stopped asking questions.
meanings.sent3: The importuner in the office would always bring up the same complaints during meetings.
meanings.sent4: The importuner in the neighborhood would knock on doors asking for donations every week.
meanings.sent5: The importuner in the park would follow people around asking for spare change.
